==Events==
*[[241 BC]] &ndash; [[First Punic War]]: [[Battle of the Aegates Islands]] &ndash; The [[Roman Republic|Romans]] sink the [[Carthage|Carthaginian]] fleet bringing the First Punic War to an end.
* [[298]] &ndash; Roman Emperor [[Maximian]] concludes his campaign in [[Africa (Roman province)|North Africa]] against the [[Berber people|Berbers]], and makes a triumphal entry into [[Carthage]].
*[[1607]] &ndash; [[Susenyos of Ethiopia|Susenyos]] defeats the combined armies of [[Yaqob of Ethiopia|Yaqob]] and [[Abuna]] Petros II at the Battle of Gol in [[Gojjam]], making him [[Emperor of Ethiopia]].
*[[1629]] &ndash; [[Charles I of England]] dissolves [[Parliament of England|Parliament]], beginning the eleven-year period known as the [[Personal Rule]].
*[[1735]] &ndash; An agreement between [[Nadir Shah]] and Russia is signed near [[Ganja (city)|Ganja]] and Russian troops are withdrawn from [[Baku]].
*[[1762]] &ndash; French [[Huguenot]] [[Jean Calas]], who had been wrongly convicted of killing his son, dies after being tortured by authorities; the event inspired [[Voltaire]] to begin a campaign for religious tolerance and legal reform.
*[[1804]] &ndash; [[Louisiana Purchase]]: In [[St. Louis, Missouri]], a formal ceremony is conducted to transfer ownership of the [[Louisiana Territory]] from France to the United States.
*[[1814]] &ndash; [[Napoleon I of France]] is defeated at the [[Battle of Laon]] in France.
*[[1816]] &ndash; [[Crossing of the Andes]]: A group of royalist scouts is captured during the [[Action of Juncalito]].
*[[1830]] &ndash; The [[KNIL]] also known as the Royal Netherlands East Indies Army is created.
*[[1831]] &ndash; The [[French Foreign Legion]] is established by King [[Louis Philippe of France|Louis Philippe]] to support his [[French rule in Algeria|war in Algeria]].
*[[1848]] &ndash; The [[Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo]] is ratified by the [[United States Senate]], ending the [[Mexican–American War]].
*[[1861]] &ndash; El Hadj [[Umar Tall]] seizes the city of [[Ségou]], destroying the [[Bambara Empire]] of [[Mali]].
*[[1876]] &ndash; [[Alexander Graham Bell]] makes the first successful [[telephone]] call by saying "Mr. Watson, come here, I want to see you."
*[[1891]] &ndash; [[Almon Strowger]], an undertaker in [[Topeka, Kansas]], patents the [[Strowger switch]], a device which led to the automation of telephone circuit switching.
*[[1906]] &ndash; The [[Courrières mine disaster]], Europe's worst ever, kills 1099 miners in Northern France.
*[[1909]] &ndash; By signing the [[Anglo-Siamese Treaty of 1909]], [[Thailand]] relinquishes its [[sovereignty]] over the [[Malay states]] of [[Kedah]], [[Kelantan]], [[Perlis]] and [[Terengganu]], which become [[British protectorates]].
*[[1917]] &ndash; Some [[Provinces of the Philippines|provinces]] and [[Cities of the Philippines|cities]] in the [[Philippines]] were incorporated due to the ratification of Act No. 2711 or the Administrative Code of the Philippines.
*[[1922]] &ndash; [[Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi|Mahatma Gandhi]] is arrested in India, tried for [[sedition]], and sentenced to six years in prison, only to be released after nearly two years for an [[appendicitis]] operation.
*[[1933]] &ndash; An [[1933 Long Beach earthquake|earthquake]] in [[Long Beach, California]] kills 115 people and causes an estimated $40 million in damage.
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[Greek Civil War]]: The [[Political Committee of National Liberation]] is established in Greece by the [[National Liberation Front (Greece)|National Liberation Front]].
*[[1945]] &ndash; The [[United States Army Air Forces|U.S. Army Air Force]] [[Bombing of Tokyo in World War II|firebombs Tokyo]], and the resulting [[conflagration]] kills more than 100,000 people, mostly civilians.
*[[1952]] &ndash; [[Fulgencio Batista]] leads a successful [[coup]] in [[Cuba]] and appoints himself as the "provisional president".
*[[1959]] &ndash; [[1959 Tibetan uprising|Tibetan uprising]]: Fearing an abduction attempt by China, 300,000 [[Tibetan people|Tibetans]] surround the [[Dalai Lama]]'s palace to prevent his removal.
*[[1966]] &ndash; Military Prime Minister of [[South Vietnam]] [[Nguyen Cao Ky]] sacked rival General [[Nguyen Chanh Thi]], precipitating [[Buddhist Uprising|large-scale civil and military dissension]] in parts of the nation.
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: [[Battle of Lima Site 85]], concluding the 11th with largest single ground combat loss of United States Air Force members (12) during that war.
*[[1969]] &ndash; In [[Memphis, Tennessee]], [[James Earl Ray]] pleads guilty to assassinating [[Martin Luther King Jr]]. He later unsuccessfully attempts to retract his plea.
*[[1970]] &ndash; Vietnam War: Captain [[Ernest Medina]] is charged by the U.S. Military with [[My Lai]] war crimes.
*[[1975]] &ndash; Vietnam War: [[1975 Spring Offensive|Ho Chi Minh Campaign]] - [[North Vietnam]]ese troops [[Battle of Ban Me Thuot|attack]] [[Ban Me Thuot]], [[South Vietnam]], on their way to capturing [[Saigon]] on the final push for victory over South Vietnam.
*[[1977]] &ndash; [[Rings of Uranus]]: Astronomers discover [[planetary rings|rings]] around [[Uranus]].
*[[1980]] &ndash; [[The Madeira School|Madeira School]] headmistress [[Jean Harris]] shoots and kills Scarsdale diet doctor [[Herman Tarnower]]
*  1980   &ndash; Formation of the Irish [[Army Ranger Wing]].
*[[1990]] &ndash; In [[Haiti]], [[Prosper Avril]] is ousted 18 months after seizing power in a [[coup]].
*[[2000]] &ndash; The [[NASDAQ Composite]] [[stock market index]] peaks at 5132.52, signaling the beginning of the end of the [[dot-com bubble|dot-com boom]].
*[[2005]] &ndash; [[Tung Chee Hwa]] resigns from his post as the first [[Chief Executive of Hong Kong]] after widespread public dissatisfaction of his tenure.
*[[2006]] &ndash; The [[Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter]] arrives at [[Mars]].
